already see page 12 **** 9 fins the fins are crocheted in row make them in a contrasting colour to the body if you like the fish has 6 fins 1 dorsal fin 2 pectoral fins 2 pelvic fins and 1 ventral fin important note whenever you work into a half_double_crochet make the stitch in the middle loop only this creates a ridged texture on both sides of each fin looking down on a row of hdcs middle loops shown in red dorsal fin make 1 1 chain 5 half_double_crochet 4 along the chain chain 1 & turn work 2 half_double_crochet 3 along row chain 1 & turn work 3 half_double_crochet 3 along row chain 1 & turn work 4 half_double_crochet 3 along row chain 1 & turn work 5 half_double_crochet 3 along row fasten_off and leave a long tail for sewing body/ventral fins make 5 1 chain 5 half_double_crochet 4 along the chain chain 1 & turn work 2 half_double_crochet 3 along row chain 1 & turn work 3 half_double_crochet 3 along row fasten_off and leave a long tail for sewing 10 attaching the fins you can customise the position of the fins however you like but place them as shown below if you want to match the no-sew version of the fish to help place the fins see the photos to the right the top back of the fish has a smoother curve and the bottom belly has more of a bulge towards the front use the tail fin and gills to help find the midline of the fish 1 dorsal/ventral fins pin the larger dorsal fin into place along the top of the fish with the tallest part of the fin towards the front the front edge of the fin should be at around round 11 pin one of the smaller fins into place along the bottom of the fish with the tallest part towards the front the front edge of the fin should be at around round 16 behind the dorsal fin sew the fins into place and hide the yarn tails inside the body 2 pectoral fins pin each pectoral fin into place just behind the gill with the longest edge at the bottom line up the bottom edge of the fin with the lowest stitch of the gill 3 pelvic fins pin each of the two remaining fins into place on the belly of the fish with the longest edges towards the midline position the front edge of each fin at around round 11 between the pectoral and ventral fins sew each fin into place along its front edge and hide the yarn tails inside the body 1 2 3 the fish is now complete and should look something like the photo on the
